title: 111_hr826
content: The Act titled "Cluster-Based Economy Enhancement Act of 2009" introduces grants for cluster-based economic development under Title II of the Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965. The "Cluster-Based Economy Enhancement Act of 2009" defines key terms such as cluster, eligible applicant, and region for the purpose of granting funds for cluster-based economic development. The "Cluster-Based Economy Enhancement Act of 2009" defines criteria for qualifying for a grant under this section, including designated regions like the Delta Region and the Northern Great Plains Region. The "Cluster-Based Economy Enhancement Act of 2009" defines criteria for qualifying for a grant under this section, including designated regions like the Delta Region, the Northern Great Plains Region, the Southeast Crescent Region, and the Southwest Border Region. The "Cluster-Based Economy Enhancement Act of 2009" defines the Northern Border Region as specified in title 40, United States Code. The Secretary may grant funds for cluster development programs in a region and support staff operating such programs, with cost sharing required. The Federal share of project costs under the Cluster-Based Economy Enhancement Act of 2009 is 50%. In-kind contributions can cover up to 50% of the non-Federal share. Section 204 does not apply. $50,000,000 is authorized for this section. "Sec. 219. Grants for cluster-based economic development."
